video_caption: The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated on a couch, speaking in front of a colorful geometric background. He begins by discussing his research background in chemistry, specifically in organic chemistry, and his interest in science. The man then elaborates on his experience in science, mentioning that he has not focused on a particular area but has been involved in various aspects of science. He shares his role as one of the launch editors of a publication and expresses his attraction to the idea of working with a team of scientists. The video maintains a consistent setting and atmosphere throughout, with the man's dialogue being the central focus.

The video features Dr. Richard White, the Chief Editor of Scientific Reports, seated in front of a colorful geometric background. He is wearing a light blue shirt and appears to be speaking, as indicated by his facial expressions and the presence of a microphone clipped to his shirt. The text overlay at the bottom of the screen reads, "There's no very typical day on Scientific Reports." As the video progresses, the text changes to "As Chief Editor, I oversee a group of eight," followed by "And we oversee the editorial decision making process" and "and the peer review process on the journal." The scene then transitions to a wider shot of an office environment, showing Dr. White seated at a desk with a computer monitor displaying a document titled "Editorial List." The office is bustling with activity, with other individuals working at their desks in the background. The video returns to Dr. White, who continues to speak, with the text overlay stating, "by our external Editorial Board Members." The final text reads, "So they are the people who decide whether to send a manuscript out to peer review." Throughout the video, the focus remains on Dr. White and his role in overseeing the editorial and peer review processes at Scientific Reports.

The video features Dr. Richard White, the Chief Editor of Scientific Reports, seated in a modern office setting with a colorful geometric background. He is wearing a light blue shirt and appears to be engaged in a conversation, likely an interview, as indicated by the presence of a microphone clipped to his shirt. Throughout the video, Dr. White discusses various topics related to his role, including the impact of peer review and the progress of projects aimed at enhancing the journal's operations. The text at the bottom of the screen provides context to his speech, highlighting key points such as the improvement in decision times and the satisfaction derived from the scale of operations. The video transitions to a white screen with a question, "What do you enjoy most about your role? What has been your highlight?" before returning to Dr. White, who continues to speak, with his name and title displayed on the screen. The overall atmosphere is professional and informative, with Dr. White appearing thoughtful and engaged in his discussion.

In the video, a man wearing a light blue shirt is seated in front of a colorful geometric background, engaged in a conversation. He is identified as Dr. Richard White, the Chief Editor of Scientific Reports, as indicated by the text overlay on the screen. The conversation revolves around the editorial criteria of the journal, emphasizing that publication decisions are not based on perceived importance, significance, or impact. Instead, the rigorous peer review processes ensure that only high-quality research is published. The man appears to be speaking directly to the camera, with his facial expressions and gestures indicating his engagement in the discussion. The setting is professional, with a modern and vibrant backdrop that adds a dynamic visual element to the scene. The text overlays provide context to the conversation, highlighting the journal's commitment to quality and the peer review process.

The video features a man in a light blue shirt seated in front of a colorful geometric background, engaged in a discussion about the criteria for selecting papers for publication. He speaks about the importance of original contributions to existing knowledge, reproducible science, thorough reporting, and the contextual presentation of conclusions within previous literature. The man appears to be in a professional setting, possibly an office or studio, with a modern and vibrant design. The video transitions to a white screen with text asking, "What is the biggest misconception about Scientific Reports that you would like to dispel?" This question prompts viewers to consider common misunderstandings about the publication process. The overall atmosphere is informative and professional, aimed at educating the audience about the standards and values of scientific reporting.

The video features Dr. Richard White, the Chief Editor of Scientific Reports, seated in a modern office setting with a colorful geometric background. He is wearing a light blue shirt and speaks about the inclusive nature of the journal, addressing misconceptions about inclusivity. The text on the screen provides context to his statements, such as "Because Scientific Reports is an inclusive journal," and "Of course, that isn't the case." The video transitions to a group of five people engaged in a discussion in a bright, contemporary office space, with one person holding a red cup and another using a laptop. The text on the screen reads, "We have rigorous, robust editorial and peer review processes," and "external Editorial Board Members." The video then returns to Dr. White, who continues to speak, emphasizing the importance of these processes. The final frame poses a question to the audience: "What advice would you give researchers planning to submit to Scientific Reports?" The video maintains a professional and informative tone throughout, with a focus on the editorial standards and inclusivity of the journal.
